headline: Scott Sheffield, the Shale Boss Spurned by Exxon, Joins Fight Against Coterra
summary: Oil boss  Scott Sheffield  has a new job: activist gunslinger.  Investment firm Kimmeridge is preparing to nominate Sheffield, the former chief executive of Pioneer Natural Resources, to join  Coterra Energy  board as part of an activist push to revamp the company, according to people familiar with the matter.  It is an unexpected twist in a brewing battle over the future of Coterra, a roughly $20 billion, public oil-and-gas producer based in Houston.

headline: Is It Too Late To Consider Exxon Mobil (XOM) After Its 26% One Year Rally?
summary: If you are wondering whether Exxon Mobil stock still offers value at current levels, you are not alone. The answer depends on how you look at its valuation. The shares last closed at US$133.61, with returns of 2.6% over 7 days, 13.1% over 30 days, 8.9% year to date and 26.5% over the past year. This naturally raises questions about how much of the story is already reflected in the price. Recent news coverage has focused on Exxon Mobil's role as a major integrated energy company, including...

headline: How Evolving Analyst Views Are Rewriting The Story For Exxon Mobil (XOM)
summary: Exxon Mobil is back in focus as analysts revise their price targets, reflecting an updated story around the stock rather than just short term noise. With the target moving from None to None, the shift highlights fresh views on the company’s risk, opportunity and where it might fit in your portfolio thinking. Stay tuned to see how you can keep on top of these evolving targets and the broader narrative from here. Stay updated as the Fair Value for Exxon Mobil shifts by adding it to your...
